content.description:
Climb jugs for hands and smears for feet. Traverse right until you can start going up near/on the arete.

 It seems likely that someone would have climbed this before me - if you know of someone who did, let me know, and I'll gladly change the FA info!
content.location: This is also on the back side of the boulder. If you go right from Back Slab, it's around the next corner.

content.description:
As the name suggest, it's pretty awkward - not particularly fun movement and really short.

 It seems likely that someone would have climbed this before me - if you know of someone who did, let me know, and I'll gladly change the FA info!
content.location: If you're standing on the trail, this is just around to the right side of the boulder. Follow the crack going up and right until you can get a hand up top.

content.description:
I don't expect this to get much repeats, except maybe as a warm up for the boulder. It's pretty mediocre.

 It seems likely that someone would have climbed this before me - if you know of someone who did, let me know, and I'll gladly change the FA info!
content.location: If you're standing on the trail facing the boulder, this would be just around to the right. Follow the crack going up and left until you can hit the top.

content.description:
This route is directly facing the trail. Traverse left until you can get a heel up, and then rock over that heel grabbing on to small face holds until you can slap the top. Finish with an easy topout.

 It seems likely that someone would have climbed this before me - if you know of someone who did, let me know, and I'll gladly change the FA info!
content.protection: 1 big pad would probably be fine, but 2 pads or 1 and a spotter is probably a decent choice.

content.description:
I started palm down on the flake on the left side. After that, it was mostly high-stepping to the top, but I bet with some cleaning there would be a more subtle way to get up.

 It seems likely that someone would have climbed this before me - if you know of someone who did, let me know, and I'll gladly change the FA info!
content.location: This face is almost exactly opposite the side of the boulder facing the trail. If you walk around back, you won't miss it.

content.description: These are a cool jumble of rocks that my mom thought looked kind of a like a turtle head poking out of its shell. It seems like a pretty obvious place to climb, there was a really clear line facing the trail, so if you know of anyone who's climbed on here before me, let me know!
